children.name: to put sb in prison as a punishment
put sb in prison a1
children.definition: put sb in prison/jailalsosend sb to prison/jail to officially order sb to be taken to prison and kept there: tống ai đó vào tù
examples: eventually, her attacker was caught and put in prison.
the judge sent him to jail for seven years.

children.name: lock sb up x
children.definition: lock up informal to put sb in prison - use this especially when you think that sb deserves to be in prison: tống tù
examples: lock sb up
rapists deserve to be locked up for the rest of their lives.
murderers should be locked up for life.
after what she did, they should lock her upand throw away the key(= lock her up until she dies) .
lock up sb
it costs $23,000 a year to lock up an adult.
locking up more criminals has helped to reduce the crime rate and produce safer streets.

children.name: imprison c1
children.definition: imprison  to put someone in prison - use this especially when you think the punishment is wrong or unfair: bỏ tù, tống giam
examples: ▪ thousands of civilians were arrested, imprisoned and killed
be imprisoned for (doing) sth
▪ two of the boys have been imprisoned for theft.
▪ the priest had been imprisoned for preaching the gospel.
imprisonment[uncountable noun]sựbỏ tù, tống giam
▪ the maximum penalty is three years’ imprisonment.
▪ it was a very sad case of false imprisonment.
imprisonverb[ t usually passive ]bỏ tù, tống giam, giam cầm
to put someone in prison
_he was imprisoned in 1965forattempted murder.
_figurativeunable to go out because of the deep snow, she felt imprisoned in her own house.

children.name: throw sb in jail u
children.definition: throw sb in jail to put sb in prison - use this especially when you think that someone does not deserve to be in prison: tống ai đó vào tù
examples: the court’s decision suggests that it is ok to throw pregnant women in jail just because they are addicted.
when they called for free elections, the government threw them all in jail.

children.name: jail x
children.definition: jail/dʒeɪl/  to put sb in prison for a fixed period of time - used especially in newspaper reports: bỏ tù
examples: many of the group’s leaders have now been jailed.
be jailed for (doing) something
about 5000 people have been jailed for crimes of terrorism or treason since 1992.
marco was arrested and jailed for accepting bribes from drug dealers.

children.name: incarcerate x
children.definition: incarcerate to put sb in prison - used in newspapers, television etc and in formal contexts: bỏ tù, tống giam
examples: carter spent 19 years incarcerated in new jersey on murder charges.
thousands of dissidents have been interrogated or incarcerated.
there are too many people on death row who are innocent of the crimes for which they are incarcerated.
incarceration[u noun] sự bỏ tù, tống giam
anyone speaking out against the regime faced death or incarceration.

children.name: intern x
children.definition: intern to put sb, especially sb from another country, in prison during a war, because they are thought to be dangerous: giam giữ
examples: the french soldiers, who had surrendered without fighting, were interned in hanoi.
thousands died. and thousands were interned in forced labour camps.
internment[u noun]sự giam giữ
one of the subjects for debate was the government’s power of internment without trial.

children.name: to force sb to stay in a place as a prisoner
detain x
children.definition: detain/dɪˈteɪn/  if the police detain sb who they think has done sth illegal, they keep them somewhere, usually in order to ask them questions: giam giữ
examples: ▪ three men from the ship have been detained for questioning by the harbour authorities.
▪ the police are now allowed to detain terrorist suspects for as long as a week.

children.name: keep a2
children.definition: keep to force sb to stay in a place, as if they were a prisoner : bắt giữ
examples: west had abducted the young girl and kept her in his basement for 10 days.
you can’t keep me here against my will - get out of my way.
keep sb in/at etc sth
the guerrillas were keeping the hostages in a camp somewhere in the jungle.
keep sb prisoner
police think that the woman may have been kept prisoner for the twenty four hours before she was murdered.

children.name: take sb hostage
children.definition: if an enemy or group of criminalstakes sbhostage,they keep that person as a prisoner, and threaten to kill or injure them unless they get what they want:bắt ai làm con tin
examples: the government is concerned that british troops might be taken hostage by guerrillas.
a band of human rights activists stormed the embassy and took several people hostage.

children.name: hold/keep sb in custody
children.definition: if the police hold or keep sb in custody they keep them in prison until it is time for them to be judged in a court: bị cảnh sát tạm giam chờ xét xử
examples: mccullough will be kept in custody until her trial on may 3rd.
hold/keep sb in police custodyin a police station
a man has been arrested in connection with the murder and is being held in police custody.

children.name: confine c2
children.definition: confine to make sb stay in a very small place, with the result that their freedom or movements are restricted: giam cầm
examples: the hostages had been confined for so long that they couldn't cope with the outside world.
confine sb to sth
the judge has confined the jury to their hotel until after the verdict.
all the illegal immigrants were confined to a small island in the harbour.
the judge is confining the jury to their hotel until after the verdict.
be confined in sth
brett was eventually confined in a psychiatric hospital, where he committed suicide.
the boy had been confined in a dark narrow room from early childhood by his parents.

children.name: hold sb prisoner
children.definition: hold somebody prisoner/captive/hostage to illegally keep sb in a place where they do not want to be, especially as a way of forcing sb to give you money or do what you want: giữ ai đó làm người tù, tù nhân, con tin trái phép
examples: police raided the building where rebels were holding 73 government employees captive.
hold sb prisoner/captive/hostage in/at etc sth
four other us citizens are being held hostage by guerrillas in colombia.
the woman had been held prisoner in larkin’s basement for 3 months.
hold sb prisoner/ hostage/ captive
several tourists were being held captive by rebels in kashmir.
militant prisoners held 24 guards hostage on friday, as jail unrest spread throughout the country.

children.name: hold b2
children.definition: hold/həʊld/  to keep sb somewhere, especially for a short period o f time, before deciding what to do with them- used especially in news reports: bắt giữ
examples: police are holding two men for questioning in connection with the robbery.
no one knows where the kidnapped woman is being held.
hold sb in/at etc sth
the prisoners were held at andersonville until more suitable places were found.

children.name: shut up x
children.definition: shut up  to put or keep sb in a place so that they are no longer free: giam giữ
examples: shut sb up/shut up sb
according to the legend, acrisius built an underground house for his daughter. here he shut her up and guarded her.
the lawyer claimed that his client had been shut up in a prison cell for hours, when there was no legal reason to keep him.
she can't spend her whole life shut upinher office.

children.name: to be in prison as a punishment
in prison/jail a1
children.definition: in prison/ jail
examples: both her sons are now in jail.
the two irishmen were in prison for five years before they were found to be innocent.
johnson pleaded guilty and was sentenced to five years in prison.
the prosecuting lawyers say that price may face life in prison.
in prison/ jail for
58% of prisoners are in jail for non-violent crimes.
they spent ten yearsinjailforfraud.

children.name: be inside x
children.definition: be inside  to be in prison - used especially by sb who has been in prison and is talking about their experience: trong tù
examples: ‘when i was inside,’ said jimmy. ‘i really learned how to look after myself.’
be inside for
her husband's insideforarmed robbery.

children.name: do time x
children.definition: do time  to be in prison for a period of time as a punishment for a crime: ngồi tù
examples: sid’s wife ran off with another man while he was doing time.
it's not always easy to find a job after you've done time.
do time for
none of us knew that greg had done time for stealing cars.

children.name: serve c2
children.definition: serve to spend a period of time in prison, especially the period that a judge has said you must spend there: thụ án
examples: serve 3 years/6 months etc (for sth)
holt is currently serving five years for child abduction.
serve time (for sth)
both the brothers had criminal records and had served time for robbery.
serve time in prison/jail
she met schmidt while serving time in prison for drug possession.serve a sentence
fowler was released after serving two-thirds of his sentence.

children.name: behind bars b2
children.definition: behind bars in prison
examples: he's spent most of his life behind bars.
he is now behind bars for child sex offences.

children.name: when sb is forced to stay swh
captivity x
children.definition: captivitywhen someone is being forced to stay in a place where they do not want to be - use this when this situation is illegal or wrong : tình trạng bị giam cầm
examples: in his book, he describes what life was like during his long captivity.
in his autobiography, mandela describes his life during captivity.
in captivity
the industrialist, who was captured on november 24th, was freed after 84 days in captivity.
the hostages are now entering their fourth week in captivity.
all the hostages, when releasedfromcaptivity, looked remarkably fit and well.
be held/kept in captivity
folkes says that he was held in captivity for over a year.

children.name: be in custody
children.definition: /biː ɪn ˈkʌstədi/  if someone who the police think is guilty of a crime is in custody, they are kept in prison until it is time for them to be judged in a court: bị bỏ tù, bị coi giữ
examples: ▪ parry was in custody for a month before being released.
be in police custodyin a police station bị bắt giữ tại đồn cảnh sát
▪ the activist died under suspicious circumstances while he was in police custody.
be remanded in custodybe sent back to prison from a court until your trial tạm giam
▪ three men and a woman have been remanded in custody on fraud charges.

children.name: imprisonment x
children.definition: imprisonment the state of being kept as a prisoner, especially as punishment for a crime: sự bỏ tù
examples: johnson was sentenced to three years’ imprisonment for causing a riot.
life imprisonment: tù chung thân
many women believe that the punishment for rape should be life imprisonment.
false imprisonment[legal] the limiting of someone's freedom without the authority or right to do so : sự bắt giam không có lý do hợp pháp
he brought civil proceedings against the police for false imprisonment.

children.name: be under arrest
children.definition: if sb is under arrest, the police are keeping them guarded because they think they are guilty of a crime: bị bắt giam, bỏ tù
examples: he’s under arrest and may only be seen by his lawyer.
be under housearrestnot be allowed to leave your home giam giữ tại nhà
the opposition leader has been under house arrest for the past few months.

children.name: detention x
children.definition: detention when sb is being kept somewhere by the police, usually because they think that person has done something illegal and they want to ask them questions: tạm giam
examples: cases of detention without trial were common in the last century.
by the 1920s the average period of detention for new immigrants lasted two weeks.
a dissident, recently released from detention, gave a press conference in the capital today.
ormerod, aged 19, was sentenced to nine months’ detention for possessing and supplying cannabis.
in detention
about a dozen people remain in detention without trial.
concern has been expressed about the deathindetention of a number of political prisoners
be held/kept in detention
marik, who had been held in detention for over a year, was eventually found not guilty.
release sb from detention
mrs davis was released from detention yesterday and all charges have been dropped.
take sb into detention
they were taken into detention two weeks ago and still are not allowed visitors.

children.name: confinement
children.definition: when someone is being kept in a room, prison etc: sự giam cầm
examples: he was sentenced to 5 months of home confinement for the crime.
many women spent a lifetime of virtual confinement in the home.
solitary confinementthe state of being kept completely alone giam riêng biệt
prisoners are punished by being put in solitary confinement.
pratt spent the first eight years of his prison sentence in solitary confinement.
surely solitary confinement for life is a horrible enough punishment.
she was kept in solitary confinement for three days.
she could see certain parallels with prisoners in solitary confinement.
